analysis.summary: Vue 3 component that displays an error banner with a message and a close icon.
analysis.purpose: Provide a standardized UI element for showing error notifications and allow parent components to react when the user closes the error.

components.name: Status
components.role: Container component rendering an error message and close button.

components.name: IconCross
components.role: Icon button used to close the error banner.

functions.name: closeError
functions.description: Emits a 'close' event to notify parent that the error banner should be hidden.

analysis.usage:
Import and register the component in a parent view or layout. Bind props (status, message, show, data) and listen for the 'close' event to hide or remove the banner:

<script setup>
import Status from '@/components/Status/Status.vue'
const showError = ref(true)
function onClose() { showError.value = false }
</script>
<template>
  <Status v-if="showError" :data="{ message: 'Something went wrong' }" @close="onClose" />
</template>
notes: The 'status' and 'message' props are defined but the template uses only data.message. Consider removing unused props or adapting template.
The imported 'computed' from Vue is not used.
The 'show' prop is declared but not referenced in the template or script logic.
Error wrapper is absolutely positioned with partial opacity for overlay effect.
There are commented-out spans in the template for potential additional debugging info.
